If it dies and it was Worthy, you get the Mana back and heal you or an ally for half of the Damage done.
<Soul Drain>.Upgrade: Also, passively, you always know if a Unit would die from this (the GM will answer yes or no).

<Mana Flow Tapping>.Effect: If Flow Tap is on Cooldown, you can spend 1 Mana to cast it regardless.

~Summon Familiar~.Effect:
Summon a familiar and choose an element which is bound to it: Fire, Cold, Shock, Light (True) or Necrotic.
The familiar takes its turn at the same time as you.
On your turn, your familiar can use its own movement to move, but you must spend your own Actions for it to take Actions.
If it dies or goes more than 30 meters away from you, it becomes unsummoned, and it is also unsummoned inbetween Adventures.
The stat block for the Familiar is on the Pets and Animals page.
~Summon Familiar~.Notes:
It is assumed you always keep your Familiar summoned, unless constrained by time, or in special situations (dictated by the GM).
You can choose what your familiar looks like, assuming it is a small creature. Your familiar comes with a name that you or the GM decides.
You can communicate with your Familiar telepathically.
The Familiar can be classified as a demon, undead, celestial, monstrosity, etc (but not beast or humanoid).

~Familiar Pet Attack~.Effect:
The familiar melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d8 + (your highest Stat) Damage (of your pet's elemental type).
~Familiar Pet Attack~.Notes: The attack is against target's Defense, of course.

~Familiar Feats~.Effect:
You also have access to the Familiar Feats.
You can choose one Familiar Feat to get for free.

<Tongues>.Effect:
You speak all Common and Wild languages.
You have +1 Spell Grade.

<Impmaster>.Effect: When you get this Talent, gain 1 Feat.

<Patron Aspect>.Effect:
You take on the shape or a being from your patron's plane until the end of your next turn.
You have +2 Intelligence, Sense and Charisma, and your Basic Spells require no mana to cast.
After you cast a Basic Spell, it goes on a Once / Adventure Cooldown (can't be used until the next Adventure).

<Dual Summonation>.Effect:
Summon 2 Dual-Imps at any spaces within 6 meters and choose a target.
These 2 imps will cast Chase Bolt and chase their target to death. Otherwise, they don't move from their spot.
They last for 10 minutes or until thet target is defeated or they can't attack it.
Imps take their turn immediately after you.
See the Pets section for the Dual-Imp stats.
<Dual Summonation>.Notes:
Imps become unsummoned at the start of their turn if the target dies or it becomes untargetable or invisible; Imps will chase around corners, though. Imps don't care about Cover; they attack anyway.
Imps aren't very smart, they don't employ tactics.

<Patron Avatar>.Effect:
You summon an Avatar of your patron and become Rooted until the Spell ends.
You and the Avatar share Actions.
The Avatar can't take Damage or be directly Crowd Controlled, but all Crowd Control you would take is also applies to it.
See the Avatar's Stats and Abilities in the Pets sections.
Lasts up to 1 minute or until you are Pushed or incapacitated (or until cancelled).
<Patron Avatar>.Notes:
You can cancel the summon at any point on your turn. The Avatar also ends if it goes more than 30 meters away from you. While the Avatar is summoned, you can't move, except with teleportation Spells.
Incapacitated means Stun, Sleep, Paralysis, etc.

~Proficiency in Athletics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Might Checks for using your physical strength (e.g. lifting, breaking by hand, etc).

~Proficiency in Acrobatics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for jumping, climbing, fitting through gaps, maintaining balance and other acrobatic moves.

~Advanced Flank~.Effect:
The first time you Flank-Attack an enemy every turn, the attack deals 1d6 Damage instead of just +1.
Also, your melee weapon attacks Flank an enemy if they are pinned against a wall or an obstacle as well.
~Advanced Flank~.Note:
Flanking is when you melee-attack an enemy, and an ally of yours is directly behind the enemy.
Also, instead of an ally being behind the enemy, your attacks count as Flanking even if there is a wall or another obstacle directly behind them.

~Rout~.Effect:
When you come within 1 meter of an Enemy, it instantly becomes Fumbling.
Then it can't be affected by Rout for the rest of the combat.
~Rout~.Note:
Multiple Warriors can't Rout the same Unit multiple times.
Rout happens when you are not in an Enemy's vicinity, and you move (or are moved) and enter its vicinity. You don't need to end your movement there to trigger Rout on it - you can enter then exit its vicinity and Rout will trigger on it.

<Quick Maneuvers>.Effect: Immediately after you make a weapon attack, use Dash, Push, Taunt or Hamstring for free. The target rolls no Check - it is applied instantly.

<Opportunity Attacks>.Effect: When an enemy moves 2 or more meters away from near you, you can make a free attack on them with a 1-Handed Melee Weapon.
<Opportunity Attacks>.Notes: If you don't have a 1-Handed Weapone equipped, you automatically freely equip one, attack with it, unequip it and equip what you previously had.

~Overpower~.Effect: Gain an additional Half-Action this turn.

<Might Over Magic>.Effect:
Choose an Advanced spell from the Elemental spell list that deals Damage.
You can cast that spell once per Adventure.
That spell becomes a physical version of itself.
Instead of using magic to cast that spell, you use your body/weapons/tools.
Come up with a description of how it works (see notes).
The Damage of that spell becomes Slash, Smash or Pierce, whichever makes sense.
It is not considered a Spell.
<Might Over Magic>.Notes:
E.g. Scorching Rays - you shoot 3 arrows with your bow (Pierce Damage).
E.g. Frost Nova - you smash the ground with such force that it Damages and slows units around you (Smash Damage).
Be creative!

<Weaponmaster>.Effect:
When you get this, choose one weapon type.
You have that weapon effect too on all weapons you use, exactly as written, no matter what weapon you are using.
You can change this weapon type inbetween Adventures.
<Weaponmaster>.Notes: Pay very close attention to the weapon effect - for example, Katana specifies that you Critical Strike with it when all 3 dice have the same number, so this can only apply to weapons that roll exactly 3 dice. Or, for another example, Slings say that attacks specifically with Slings take 0.33 Actions, so it can not apply to any other weapon!

~Upper Hand~.Effect: You can Advanced Flank twice per turn (with 2 different attacks).

<Into the Fray>.Effect:
When combat starts, determine which side is your Allied Side and which is the Enemy Side of the battlefield. Each side has a direction (Allied Direction and Enemy Direction).
If you end your turn more to the Allied Direction than you started, you gain 4 Shielding until the start of your next turn.
If you end your turn more to the Enemy Direction than you started, your first attack next turn deals 1d6 extra Damage.

<Glory Run>.Effect:
When combat starts, a Glory Point appears behind the furthermost Enemy from you that you can see.
If you touch the Glory Point, heal for 20% of your total Health and all Enemies you can see must pass a Charisma Check or be Crippled.
The Glory Point then disappears.
<Glory Run>.Notes: The Glory Point is not a physical thing. It's merely a concept (a point).

<Ruining Throw>.Effect:
Throw a weapon at a target and attack it (without Throwing penalties and ignoring Cover).
Before applying the Damage, the attack destroys all Shielding and Defense on the target and removes all buffs on it.
The target is unable to trigger "on roll", can't gain Shielding and can't benefit from Buffs until they spend an Action to recover.
<Ruining Throw>.Upgrade: Epic Monsters gain ther Defense back when they spend the Action to recover.
<Ruining Throw>.Notes:
Your weapon lands at the nearest space to the target (and you should probably pick it up with a Half-Action).
"On roll" refers to effects like "if it rolls 10 on a d10, the attack deals 1d10 extra Damage".
Buffs are all effects that improve the target; even passive effects like auras or passive stats from abilities are negated.
You don't need Training in Throwning and this attack counts as a regular melee attack.

~Onslaught~.Effect: Whenever YOU kill a worthy enemy, heal for 1d6 Health.

~Reckless Attack~.Effect: After you land a weapon attack, deal 2d6 extra Damage to the target, and half that amount to yourself.
~Reckless Attack~.Notes: Your Defense does not mitigate this Damage.

~Undying Rage~.Effect: Taking Damage that would kill you leaves you at 1 Health instead.

<Heartbeat Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 Damage.
Enter a Heart Trance for 1 minute.
While in Heart Trance, you take 50% less Damage from all non-Physical combat Damage (except from your own abilities).
When Heart Trance ends, heal for 2d6.
<Heartbeat Trance>.Notes: You can activate this as a Reaction when you would take Damage.

<Rage Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 Damage.
Until the end of your next turn, you are immune to all Crowd Control except Blinded.
Your attacks while in Rage Trance have an extra +1 Damage to all attacks.
When Rage Trance ends, heal for 2d6.
<Rage Trance>.Notes: You can activate this as a Reaction when you would be Crowd Controlled.

<Battle Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 Damage.
Enter a Battle Trance that lasts until the end of your next turn.
You gain a protective shield around you which absorbs up to Your Might + Your Level physical Damage.
When Battle Trance ends, heal for 2d6, and the shield fades.
<Battle Trance>.Notes: You can activate this as a Reaction when you would take Damage.

~Marksmanship~.Effect: YOU can flank a Unit from up to 6 meters away (if you, the target and the ally/wall/obstacle are on the same line).
~Marksmanship~.Notes: As usual, that wall/obstacle/ally helping with your flank must right behind the target (meaning allies can't flank an enemy with you being 6 meters away).

~Load Up~.Effect:
You 'load up' your weapons.
After you 'load up', your Advanced Flank deals 1d12 Damage instead of 1d6, but every time you use it, the Damage decreases by one tier (e.g. 1d12, 1d10, 1d8, 1d6, 1d4).
If your Advanced Flank die is 1d8 or more, after you roll it, you can choose to reroll it and you must keep the new result (once per turn).

~Point Mark~.Effect:
Mark a point on the ground.
Allies and you can use the mark to flank targets.

<Recoil Shot>.Effect:
Dash up to 2 meters away from the target.
Push the target 2 meters away. It takes 1d8 Damage if it collides with something.
<Recoil Shot>.Notes: This does not trigger attacks of opportunity.

<Harpoon>.Effect:
Make a ranged attack that deals 2d12 + 3 Damage.
The target makes a Dexterity Check.
If it fails, it is pulled to you.
Otherwise, you are pulled to it.
<Harpoon>.Notes: Requires a Harpoon, which can be bought for 50 Gold.

<Precise Weapon>.Effect:
Choose any weapon and make it Precise.
The weapon's scaling becomes +4 instead of scaling with a Stat.
The wielder of the weapon is also immune to being Crippled and has +1 Movement Speed.
<Precise Weapon>.Notes: You can only have one weapon made Precise at a time. When you make a different weapon Precise, the other one loses its Precise properties.

<Ground Aim Lock>.Effect:
On your turn, you can lower yourself on the ground.
Your first attack every turn while on the ground like this deals +1d6 Damage.
To get up, you must use all of your Movement or a Half-Action.

<Scatterblast>.Effect:
Make an attack on a target for 4d8 + 3 Smash Damage.
The impact is so powerful that all Units within 3 meters of the target take the final Damage taken by the target.
This attack is affected by your Reload state.

~Herbivore~.Effect:
You have +3 Reserve Health.
You take 150% Damage from all Poison Damage (after Defense).
Half of your meals can consist of grass and leaves, but you can not eat meat.
~Herbivore~.Notes: If you eat meat, you take 1d12 Damage and become Exhausted for 1 hour.

~Skipper~.Effect:
You are immune to Slows.
Also, you can freely jump up to 3 meters in length and/or height without rolling a Check (still uses 3 meters of your Movement).
~Skipper~.Notes:
If playing with grid, you can jump over 2 squares and land in the next one.
You can jump over enemies, but you still become Fumbling if you exit their melee attack range.

~Know Thy Enemy~.Effect: When making Units roll Dexterity or Might Resist Checks, roll 1d4 and subtract it from their Check.

~Thick Fur~.Effect:
You only take 50% Cold Damage (after Defense).
You take no extra Damage when being Flanked.
~Thick Fur~.Notes: Flanking is when you are attacked by an enemy, and there's another enemy right behind you (relative to the attacker).

~Gatherer Instincts~.Effect:
You now only take 50% Poison and Acid Damage and you can eat meat.
You have +5 on Checks for identifying plants, fruits, mushrooms, vegetables, etc.
~Gatherer Instincts~.Notes: You are now no longer weak to Poison (from the Herbivode Ability).

~Innate Dexterity~.Effect: Your Dexterity increases by 1 (up to +3) and your Dexterity Resist Checks increase by an extra +1.
~Innate Dexterity~.Notes: Remember to increase your Initiative by +1, as your Dexterity is added to your Initiative. Also, your Defense might increase if you're unarmored (see Armors).

~I Am Speed~.Effect:
In Abilities that use Sense, Intelligence or Charisma, you can use your Dexterity instead.
Your Spell Grade becomes 6 + your Dexterity.
~I Am Speed~.Notes: E.g. Chilling Shout becomes 12 + your Dexterity instead of 12 + your Charisma. Phase Orb becomes 2d6 + Dexterity + Dexterity instead of 2d6 + Intelligence + Charisma.

~Alignment~.Effect:
Determine the true personality alignment of your character.
Choose if you are Evil, Neutral or Virtuous. Your other Abilities must reflect your alignment.
If your alignment changes throughout the adventure, your traits will automatically change to reflect your alignment.
~Alignment~.Notes: The GM decides if your alignment has changed based on your actions and character development.

~Demonic Ancestry~.Effect:
Effect: In Abilities that use Sense or Intelligence, you can use your Charisma instead.
You can safely consume 2 Potions within 1 hour without risking overdose.
You can not consume cooked food. If you are Virtuous, you can eat only raw vegetables and plants; if you are Evil, you can eat only raw meat; if you are Neutral, you can eat either.
~Demonic Ancestry~.Notes: E.g. Chilling Shout becomes 12 + your Dexterity instead of 12 + your Charisma. Phase Orb becomes 2d6 + Intelligence + Dexterity instead of 2d6 + Intelligence + Charisma.

~Davel Stare~.Effect: A target must pass a Sense Check or be Charmed if you are Virtuous, Blinded if you are Neutral or Feared if you are Evil.

~Davel Gift~.Effect:
If you are Virtuous, heal another target for 1d10 Health.
If you are Evil, Damage another target for 1d10 Psychic Damage.
If you are Neutral, another ally gains 1 Mana and 5 Shielding for 1 minute.
~Davel Gift~.Notes: You can't cast this on yourself.

~Stubbornness~.Effect: You gain +2 in Might and Sense Resist Checks, and your alignment Abilities and traits can't change anymore and stay the same as they are now, even if your real alignment changes.
~Stubbornness~.Notes: That means you keep your Ability effect by alignment, food particularities, etc.

~Hellish Magic~.Effect:
You Know 2 Basic Abilities that deal Fire Damage from any Ability List.
You can change these Abilities inbetween Adventures.
~Hellish Magic~.Notes: You still need to match the Level requirement, if any (e.g. Fireball requires Level 4).

~Slow Metabolism~.Effect:
Your Total Reserve Health increases by 3 and your lifespan by 50%.
When you drink a potion, its effect is delayed by up to 8 hours.
For 0 Actions, you can instantly apply the drank potion's effect ahead of time.
~Slow Metabolism~.Notes:
This is useful when consuming potions in combat, or when you need to quickly apply the effect of a potion.
This counts as if you consumed the potion when you use the 0 Actions, or when the 8 hours expire (e.g. for overdose).

~Wingspan~.Effect: Quickly fly up to 5 meters (e.g. almost instantly).
~Wingspan~.Upgrades: At Levels 3, 6 and 9, you get one extra use of Wingspan per Adventure (e.g. the Cooldown becomes 2 times / Adventure, 3 times / Adventure, etc).

~Draconic Ancestry~.Effect:
When creating your character, choose any element from Acid, Cold, Fire, Shock, Force, Poison and Necrotic.
That becomes your Dragonborn Element.
~Draconic Ancestry~.Notes: The color of your skin and scales as a Dragonborn should reflect the element you chose (e.g. Cold might be associated with white or blue Dragonborns).

~Dragonborn Resistance~.Effect: You take only 50% Damage from your Dragonborn Element type.

~Dragon's Breath~.Effect:
Breathe your Dragonborn Element in an area determined on your chosen shape (see below).
Make an attack against all Units caught in your breath.
The attack deals 2d6 + 2 Damage of your Dragonborn Element.
~Dragon's Breath~.Upgrade: At Levels 3, 6 and 9, you get one extra use of Dragon's Breath per Adventure (e.g. the Cooldown becomes 2 times / Adventure, 3 times / Adventure, etc).
~Dragon's Breath~.Notes: If by any chance your Dragon's Breath has no shape, it shoots in a 3x1 meter line from your position.

~Breath - Area~.Effect: Your Dragon's Breath now breathes in a 3x3 meter area.

~Breath - Line~.Effect: Your Dragon's Breath now breathes in a 4x2 meter line.

~Breath - Blast~.Effect: Your Dragon's Breath now breathes on all Units within 2 meter of you.

~Second Skin~.Effect:
Choose one more color from Draconic Ancestry.
You also gain Dragonborn Resistance to that color's element.
You can freely change Dragon's Breath to that element.

~Forceful Breath~.Effect:
Your Dragon's Breath now deals 2d8 + 3 Damage.
Also, all Units affected by Dragon's Breath must make a Might Check or be pushed 4 meters away from you.

~Breath Control~.Effect: You can use Dragon's Breath one extra time per Adventure.

~Dwarf Resting~.Effect: As a Dwarf, you sleep in one single 8 hour cycle, without dreaming or moving in your sleep. You can also choose to hibernate for up to 48 hours without needing to eat or drink. If you do, you cure all normal diseases and poisons on you.
~Dwarf Resting~.Notes: Loud noises and movement still wake you up as they normally would.

~Thick Feet~.Effect: Your movement speed can't be reduced below 4 meters by Armor and you are immune to being Slowed.
~Thick Feet~.Notes:
You are not immune to Roots.
Hard Terrain still takes 2 meters of movement for 1 meter of Hard Terrain.

~Stone-Like Bones~.Effect:
Your bones are tough as rock.
You only take 50% Damage from falling and from traps that deal physical Damage.
Your Reserve Health pool increases by 3.

~Runesmith~.Effect:
You permanently know 2 Basic Abilities from the Arcane or Conjuration Basic Ability Lists.
You gain Proficiency in Arcana (see Proficiencies).
~Runesmith~.Notes:
You can't change these Spells, so choose wisely.
You must still respect the Level requirement for these Spells, if any.

~Adapted Resting~.Effect: At the start of each Adventure, you start with 1d8 Shielding that lasts for up to 24 hours.

~Skill of Trade~.Effect:
Your Charisma increases by 1 (up to a maximum of +3).
You can get free shelter and food in inns and taverns (if you would normally be able to pay for them).
You gain an extra +5 to Checks when checking stone walls, doors, statues, etc.

~Meditation~.Effect:
As an Elf, your sleep is more akin to meditation and you only need 4 hours of sleep per night.
Elves don't dream and can still hear and smell while sleeping, but at a lower responsiveness.

~The Blade Dance~.Effect: When YOU kill a Worthy Enemy, you reset your movement and are immune to Fumbling this turn.
~The Blade Dance~.Notes: If you were already Fumbling, you remove it. You can continue your Movement.

~Arcane Veins~.Effect: You have access to the Arcane Spell School, no matter what class you are.

~Lithe~.Effect: While below 50% Health, you are immune to Fumbling and you can Break your Movement into as many parts as you want.
~Lithe~.Notes:
Fumbling is when you move away from an enemy's melee attack range; if you are Fumbling, all your actions have Cover.
Breaking your Movement means you can Move, do an Action, then continue your Movement.

~Mana Tap~.Effect: A Unit within 3 meters must pass an Intelligence Check or be Silenced.

~Natural Swiftness~.Effect: This turn, you gain +5 Movement Speed and can Break your Movement into as many parts as you want.
~Natural Swiftness~.Notes: Breaking your Movement means you can Move, do an Action, then continue your Movement.

~Landsperson~.Effect: Choose one land specialty Ability from Coven of the Land Druid specialization and learn it permanently (e.g. choose between Raise Wall, Storm, Wild Roots and Endurance and you get it).
~Landsperson~.Notes: This can't be changed, so choose wisely!

~Agile Technique~.Effect: You can use any weapon with your Dexterity Stat (instead of Might, in some cases).

~Inherited Tastes~.Effect:
As a Gnome, you don't age from the passing of time. Instead, you age more rapidly when you are suffering emotionally (about 10 times faster than a human, in periods when you're depressed, anxious, fearful, etc).
You don't have a sense of taste, but your eyes perceive colors sharper than other races.
Gnomes' daydreams tend to be very vivid, almost as vivid as regular dreams at night or akin to hallucinations.

~Lucky Presence~.Effect: After another Unit you can see of you makes a roll, you can force them to reroll one die once and keep the new result.
~Lucky Presence~.Upgrade: At Level 4, you can use this twice per Adventure.

~Catch Me If You Can~.Effect:
This turn, you are immune to Fumbling.
Also, passively, your Movement Speed increases by 1 meter.

~Oh, My Tongue!~.Effect:
You now have a sense of taste. Congratulations!
You can detect whether something is poisonous by licking it without being affected by that poison.
You have 50% resistance to Acid and Poison.

~Luckier~.Effect: You can use Lucky Presence once more per Adventure.

~Environmentalist~.Effect:
You can move normally through Hard Terrain.
You gain access to the Nature Basic Ability List, regardless of your Class.

~Little Handed~.Effect:
You can move through spaces of enemy Units.
You can climb and ride on the back of an ally and move with them on their turn (without them having a Speed penalty).

~Undeath~.Effect:
You are immune to common Diseases.
You take 150% Damage from Fire and attacks done with silver weapons.
You do not require food to survive, but you do require 8 hours of sleep per day and water.
You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.
You can stay Fallen for up to 7 days before dying for good.
You are considered Undead.

~Valiant~.Effect:
When you drop to or below 0 Health, you can still take your next turn without penalty and your Health remains 0.
After your next turn, if your Health is 0 or less, you Fall.
You also Fall in that time if you take Damage again (and your Health can thus go below 0).

~Sense Souls~.Effect: You know the locations of any living Units within 15 meters that are not obstructed by thick materials.
~Sense Souls~.Notes: The more obstructed the space between you and living Units is, the fainter you feel it. 2 meters of obstruction completely hides the Units.

~Beating Heart~.Effect:
You slow down the decaying of your body and increase your life span by up to 100 years.
You can stay unconscious for up to 1 week before dying.
Your maximum health also increases by 3.

~O.B.E.~.Effect:
Your soul temporarily exits your body, leaving your body motionless on the ground (Stunned).
While outside your body, the soul can't do anything except move around normally at your current speed and perceive.
~O.B.E.~.Notes: You can return to your body for 0 Actions.

~Kindled~.Effect:
You are no longer weak to Fire Damage.
After every worthy combat encounter, if your Health is below 25% and you are not Fallen, heal back to 25% Health.

~Numb Revenge~.Effect:
Choose an enemy near you.
That enemy performs an attack on you.
If you survive the attack, you gain 1 Action which you can use to make one attack or use one Ability on that enemy.

~Proficiency in Persuasion~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for persuading people non-agressively (convincing them through dialogue).

~Human Vigilence~.Effect: Whenever you make a Check (before the roll), instead of rolling, you can automatically take the number 5 for the die (as if you rolled 5) for that Check.

~Talented~.Effect: You start with Training in any 2 Weapon Categories or Proficiencies (or one of each).
~Talented~.Notes: The 5 Weapon Categories are 1-Handed Melee Weapons, 2-Handed Melee Weapons, 1-Handed Ranged Weapons, 2-Handed Ranged Weapons, and Shields.

~Human Diversity~.Effect:
Choose any other Race (except Davel).
Gain one of its Racial Feats.
~Human Diversity~.Notes: Go to that Race's page and look for its Racial Feats list. You can't pick one that upgrades an Ability you don't have (e.g. an upgrade to Dragon's Breath).

~Social Talent~.Effect: Your Charisma increases by +1 (up to +3), your Charisma Resist Checks by an extra +1 and you can understand the intent, tonality or general idea of written texts and spoken phrases in any language you don't speak.

~Magic Diversity~.Effect: Pick either Arcane, Eldritch or Divine, and you can also Know Abilities from that Ability List, on top of the Ability Lists from your Class.

~Ignorance Bliss~.Effect:
In Abilities that use Sense, Intelligence or Charisma, you can use the number 3 instead.
If your Spell Grade is less than 9, it becomes 9.
You gain Proficiency in Luck.
~Ignorance Bliss~.Notes: E.g. Chilling Shout becomes 12 + your Dexterity instead of 12 + 3. Phase Orb becomes 2d6 + 3 + 3 instead of 2d6 + Intelligence + Charisma.

~Boiling Blood~.Effect:
Use after you make a Damage roll.
Increase the dice Damage of it by 50%.
~Boiling Blood~.Notes:
Extra Abilities over an attack are not increased (e.g. Smite), because they are an extra Damage roll. Only increase the total numbers on the dice by 50%, rounded down, without bonuses.
Note that some Abilities have multiple rolls, like Magic Missile, Slam, etc.

~Battle Anguish~.Effect:
You do not suffer Exhaustion when you are healed and rise from being Fallen in combat.
However, after you Fall in combat, you can no longer use Abilities that Heal or cost 0 Actions (for the rest of this combat).

~Fierceness~.Effect: You can use any weapon with your Might Stat (instead of Dexterity, in some cases).

~Adaptability~.Effect: Your Spell Grade becomes 7 + your Might.

~Bloodthirst~.Effect: Gain an additional Half-Action this turn.

~Savage Attacks~.Effect:
Use after you roll for Damage.
Choose one of the rolled Damage dice and double its value.

~Bloodshed Wish~.Effect: You gain +1 Might or Dexterity (if it's lower than your highest stat), and you can Know Abilities from the Bloodshed Ability List, even if it's not normally available to your Class.
